subsc: Sub-national government administration,Solid waste management,Flood protection,Sewerage,Irrigation and drainage

abstracts.cdata!:
The Antananarivo Plain Development
            Project's outcome is rated satisfactory. The living
            conditions of the low income population in the Antananarivo
            Plain have been improved. The lessons learned include: 1) It
            would have been preferable to undertake a review of issues
            and opportunities in the region in order to define a set of
            priorities. When faced with a range of issues, a set of more
            focused, complementary projects could achieve better results
            within a broader development program for the region. 2)
            Cofinancing should be targeted to discrete projects of a
            larger program or to discrete, physically unlinked
            components of a single project to avoid interruption when
            problems occur with one cofinancier. 3) Flood control
            projects of this magnitude require support and funding from
            national budgets as well as from local sources to make sure
            the system will operate over the long term. Sustained
            commitment is needed from high levels of the government. 4)
            When projects are substantially delayed, the Bank should
            review the project objectives to assess whether
            restructuring is advisable. 5) The definition of the
            institutional and resource mobilization arrangements to
            ensure sustainability after implementation should not be
            postponed until long after appraisal. Alternatives should be
            carefully assessed, and an explicit plan should be agreed
            upon at appraisal.
